Authors: So I.G., Setiadi N.J., Papak B., Aryanto R.
Title: Action design of information systems security governance for bank using COBIT 4.1 and control standard of ISO 27001
Affiliations: Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, Indonesia; Widyatama University, Bandung, Indonesia
Authors with affiliations: So, I.G., Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, Indonesia; Setiadi, N.J., Widyatama University, Bandung, Indonesia; Papak, B., Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, Indonesia; Aryanto, R., Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, Indonesia
Abstract: The aim of the study is to design remediation information systems security governance at Bank. This study provided proposed solutions to solve the existing gaps between the current condition and the expected information systems of the bank's security governance. A case study of a commercial bank is used in this study. There are 7 process frameworks of COBIT 4.1 used to measure the maturity level of information systems security governance. Of these processes, appropriate controls within the framework of COBIT 4.1 and ISO27001 are undertaken. As a result, the security of governance information systems is increasing. In conclusion, there is a need of reliable information systems security governance to achieve the intended business goals. © (2014) Trans Tech Publications, Switzerland.
Author Keywords: COBIT 4.1; Information systems security governance; ISO 27000
Index Keywords: Electronics engineering; Information systems; COBIT 4.1; Commercial bank; Control standards; Expected informations; Information systems security; ISO 27000; Process framework; Security governances; Process control
